changes.summary: Free tier replaced with $9/mo Starter plan with monthly credits
changes.previous_state: 5,000 free queries/month, 3 QPS
changes.current_state: $9/mo for ~1,000 queries + credits, new attribution requirement

changes.summary: Free tier replaced with pay-per-use + $10 one-time credit
changes.previous_state: Free basic endpoints (Like, Follow, List, etc.)
changes.current_state: Pay-per-use pricing, $10 one-time credit for existing users, free plan expired Feb 13

changes.summary: Premium subscription now required for development mode, test users cut from 25 to 5
changes.previous_state: Free developer access to Web API, 25 test users
changes.current_state: Spotify Premium subscription required for dev mode, 5 test users max, multiple endpoints deprecated

changes.summary: Free access ended after 10+ years, now $1,400/year + per-call fees starting April 30
changes.previous_state: Free API access for 10+ years
changes.current_state: $1,400/year subscription + per-call fees (effective April 30, 2026)

changes.summary: $5 Hacker tier eliminated, features merged into free and higher tiers
changes.previous_state: $5/mo Hacker tier with custom domains and more storage
changes.current_state: Free tier and $10/mo+ paid tiers only, Hacker tier removed

changes.summary: Community Edition (open-source) shutting down entirely on March 23, 2026
changes.previous_state: Free open-source Community Edition with core AWS service emulation
changes.current_state: Paid-only (Starter at $35/mo). CE no longer maintained after March 23

changes.summary: Free tier rate limits reduced 50-80%, Gemini 2.0 Flash deprecated
changes.previous_state: Higher rate limits on free tier, Gemini 2.0 Flash available
changes.current_state: Reduced rate limits, 2.0 Flash retiring March 31 2026, 3.x paid-only, 2.5 series free tier preserved

changes.summary: Restructured to credit-based pricing; sites pause on credit exhaustion
changes.previous_state: Traditional tiered pricing with fixed monthly allowances
changes.current_state: 300 credits/month free, sites pause on exhaustion

changes.summary: Project pause policy tightened — inactive projects now pause after 1 week
changes.previous_state: Longer inactivity window before project pause
changes.current_state: Projects pause after 1 week of inactivity on free tier

changes.summary: Queues added to Workers free plan — message queuing now free
changes.previous_state: Queues was paid-only
changes.current_state: Queues included in free Workers plan

changes.summary: Hosted runners 39% cheaper across all tiers
changes.previous_state: Previous per-minute pricing for hosted runners
changes.current_state: 39% reduction in per-minute pricing for hosted runners

changes.summary: Launched free tier for MCP Web Server — 5,000 requests/month for agent developers
changes.previous_state: Paid-only web scraping API
changes.current_state: 5,000 free monthly requests on Rapid mode, includes search_engine and scrape_as_markdown tools, handles JS rendering and CAPTCHAs

changes.summary: Managed Payments (Merchant of Record) service entering general availability — Stripe handles tax, billing, fraud, and disputes
changes.previous_state: Payment processing only — developers handled tax compliance, fraud, and disputes separately
changes.current_state: Managed Payments acts as Merchant of Record in 75+ countries, handling sales tax/VAT/GST, fraud prevention, dispute resolution, and transaction-level support

changes.summary: Free team collaboration removed — free plan restricted to single user only
changes.previous_state: Free plan supported multiple users in shared workspaces with collection sharing
changes.current_state: Free plan = 1 user only. Teams require Basic ($14/user/mo) or higher

changes.summary: Forge platform moved from free to consumption-based billing for compute and storage
changes.previous_state: Entirely free — no charges for compute, storage, or KV operations
changes.current_state: Free monthly allowances per app (100K GB-sec compute, 0.1 GB KVS, 1 GB logs, 1 hr SQL), usage above thresholds billed

changes.summary: Volume snapshots now billed — previously free automatic snapshots now cost $0.08/GB-month
changes.previous_state: Automatic volume snapshots included at no cost, enabled by default
changes.current_state: $0.08/GB-month for snapshot storage, first 10 GB free. Snapshots can be disabled to avoid charges

changes.summary: SQLite storage billing began for Durable Objects — previously free during beta
changes.previous_state: SQLite storage in Durable Objects was free during public beta (compute already billed)
changes.current_state: Storage charged per GB-hour on Workers Paid plan, first 10 GB included. Free plan users unaffected

changes.summary: Control plane fee announced for self-hosted runners in private repos ($0.002/min), then postponed
changes.previous_state: Self-hosted runners incurred no GitHub fees — users paid only for own infrastructure
changes.current_state: Fee announced for March 2026 but postponed. $0.002/min planned for job orchestration on self-hosted runners in private/internal repos. Public repos exempt

changes.summary: Switched from performance units to spans-based metrics for error and performance monitoring
changes.previous_state: Performance units pricing model
changes.current_state: Spans-based metrics: Developer plan includes 50K errors + 10M spans/month free. Reserved volume pricing replaces on-demand

changes.summary: Moved to fully usage-based pricing model post-Databricks acquisition — free tier storage now per-project, projects increased 10→100, branches capped at 10 per project, Neon Auth added
changes.previous_state: Free tier: 0.5 GB total storage, 191.9 compute hours, 10 projects, unlimited branches
changes.current_state: Free tier: 0.5 GB per project (up to 5 GB across 100 projects), 100 CU-hours/month per project, 10 branches/project, Neon Auth 60K MAU, auto-scaling up to 2 CU, scale-to-zero

changes.summary: Pro plan moved to credit-based model ($20/mo credit pool), Hobby plan metrics renamed and restructured — bandwidth→Fast Data Transfer, serverless split into Active CPU + Provisioned Memory, Blob Storage and Image Transformations added
changes.previous_state: Hobby: 100 GB bandwidth, 100 GB-hours serverless. Pro: fixed per-resource allocations
changes.current_state: Hobby: 100 GB/mo Fast Data Transfer, 4 hrs Active CPU, 360 GB-hrs Provisioned Memory, 1M edge requests, 1 GB Blob Storage, 5K image transformations. Pro: $20/mo credit pool across all resources, SAML SSO and HIPAA included

changes.summary: Data Center pricing increased 15-40% across Jira, Confluence, and JSM. New DC licenses end March 30 — cloud mandatory for new customers
changes.previous_state: Standard Data Center pricing with Advantaged/legacy discounts
changes.current_state: 15% standard list increase, 18-40% for legacy Advantaged pricing tiers. No new DC licenses after March 30, 2026. Full DC end-of-life March 2029

changes.summary: Docker Pro +80% ($5→$9/mo), Team +67% ($9→$15/mo). Free tier: Build Cloud minutes removed, Scout repos cut 3→1, private repos limited to 1 with 2GB storage
changes.previous_state: Pro $5/user/month, Team $9/user/month. Free tier included Build Cloud minutes, 3 Scout repos
changes.current_state: Pro $9/user/month, Team $15/user/month. Free: 1 private repo (2GB), 1 Scout repo, no Build Cloud minutes, 40 pulls/hour

changes.summary: Hatch startup program expanded to up to $100K compute credits plus up to 3 months free H100 GPU access for AI/ML startups
changes.previous_state: Standard Hatch startup credits program
changes.current_state: Up to $100K compute credits (12 months, excludes GPU). Separate GPU benefit: discounted H100 at ~$1.90/hr (vs $3.39 standard) plus up to 3 months free GPU access

changes.summary: Google for Startups Cloud Program now offers up to $350K GCP credits for AI-first startups, plus $10K Anthropic (Claude) partner credits via Model Garden
changes.previous_state: Up to $200K GCP credits for standard startups
changes.current_state: Scale AI Tier: up to $350K GCP credits ($250K year 1, $100K year 2). Standard: $200K. Partner credits: $10K Anthropic/Claude via Model Garden, Fireworks AI, MongoDB Atlas, CockroachDB, 1yr free GitLab Ultimate

changes.summary: EC2 Capacity Blocks for ML GPU prices increased ~15% across regions. p5e.48xlarge went from $34.61 to $39.80/hr (US East) and $43.26 to $49.75/hr (US West N. California)
changes.previous_state: p5e.48xlarge at $34.61/hr (US East), $43.26/hr (US West N. California) for Capacity Blocks
changes.current_state: p5e.48xlarge at $39.80/hr (US East), $49.75/hr (US West N. California). ~15% increase across most GPU Capacity Block instances

changes.summary: Google Developer Program Premium merged into Google One AI Pro ($19.99/mo, includes $10 Cloud credits) and AI Ultra ($100 Cloud credits). Developer benefits now bundled into consumer AI subscriptions
changes.previous_state: Separate Developer Program Premium subscription ($299/year) with dev tools and perks
changes.current_state: Developer benefits folded into AI Pro ($19.99/mo, $10 Cloud credits for Vertex AI/Cloud Run/Gemini API) and AI Ultra ($100 Cloud credits). Developer Program Premium being phased out for @gmail.com accounts

changes.summary: Assistants API deprecated, full shutdown August 26, 2026. Developers must migrate to Responses API + Conversations API
changes.previous_state: Assistants API available with code interpreter, file search, function calling, and Threads for conversation management
changes.current_state: Deprecated. Full shutdown Aug 26, 2026. Migration required: Assistants → Prompts + Responses API, Threads → Conversations API. No automated migration tool provided
